info.title: Analyzer and HUB API
info.description:
The definition of the software interface between analyzers and the HUB.  The interface will be implemented as a RESTful interface with all server endpoints hosted on the Analyzer.

The following requirements will be met by all interfaces: 
1. All data passed back from server shall be in JSON format.  
2.  All query parameters and JSON data properties shall be named with a prefix indicating data type: s-string, b-boolean, n-number, o-object, a-array of multiple types, ax-array of any of the other types where x denotes the types in the array.
3.  All query parameters and JSON data properties shall be named using camel case. 
4. All data types that describe a measurement value shall end with an underscore followed by the unit of that physical value.  i.e. nMotorCurrent_mA.  
Note: Naming conventions will not be met on error returns as those are handled by the base library.

get.description: The HUB is requesting the analyzer send all information about its version

200.description: Analyzer response with all version information

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

404.description: This response is sent to a request to a server endpoint that is not defined

405.description: This response is sent to any request sent to a valid location but with an method that is not supported

500.description: This response is sent to any request whose subsequent server response violates the predefined response schema

503.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

get.description: The HUB is requesting the Analyzer send a single part of the its version information

parameters.name: sPartialVersionInfo
parameters.description: The specific part of the analyzer version

200.description: Analyzer is responding with a single part of its version information as requested

500.description: This response is sent to any request whose subsequent server response violates the predefined response schema

503.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

put.description: The HUB is requesting the analyzer set a specific configuration values

schema.description: An object containing all the key value pairs that the HUB would like to update on the analyzer

200.description: Analyzer successfully made configuration changes requested by the HUB

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

put.description: Cause an analyzer to blink its light ring.  The purpose of this is to identify an analyzer. If you have multiple analyzers of the same kind it is nice to have a way to get a visual que which is which instead of having to read the serial number of each analyzer to identify it.

200.description: Analyzer was successful blinking the light ring as requested by the HUB

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

404.description: This response is sent to a request to a server endpoint that is not defined

405.description: This response is sent to any request sent to a valid location but with an method that is not supported

500.description: This response is sent to any request whose subsequent server response violates the predefined response schema

503.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

put.description: Cause an analyzer to turn off its light ring.

200.description: Analyzer was successful the light ring is off as requested by the HUB

200.description: Analyzer successfully initiated a reboot

put.description: Go from a state of no power to powered. The Dx Modules don't support wake on LAN, so this will mean return from low power mode

200.description: Analyzer successfully powered on or woke up

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

404.description: This response is sent to a request to a server endpoint that is not defined

405.description: This response is sent to any request sent to a valid location but with an method that is not supported

503.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

put.description: Go from a state of powered to no power. This behavior of this action will depend on what a particular analyzer supports. If it doesn't support power off, go to 'deep sleep' mode

200.description: Analyzer successfully began to power off or go to sleep

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

put.description: Restore the analyzer to the state it was in when it left the factory. All settings and data are removed.

200.description: Analyzer successfully began a factory reset

get.description: Return a list of all consumable types the analyzer supports. Each consumable returned will include a universally unique identifier, which will be used by the IC when starting a measurement. Any information required to run a consumable will be described in the response using the JSON Schema format (https://json-schema.org/).

200.description: Analyzer is responding the HUB with a detailed list of all supported consumables.

get.description: The HUB is requesting the analyzer send past results between two times

parameters.name: sStartTime
parameters.description: The time to start looking for results to return

parameters.name: sStartDate
parameters.description: The date to start looking for results to return

parameters.name: sEndTime
parameters.description: The time to stop looking for results to return

parameters.name: sEndDate
parameters.description: The date to stop looking for results to return

200.description: Analyzer is responding with the results of all measurements taken between the times in the request

get.description: The HUB can use send this message to get the status of an analyzer

200.description: Analyzer is responding with its status

get.description: The HUB is requesting the analyzer respond with a list of all currently activated events

200.description: Analyzer is responding with a list of all currently activated events

400.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

404.description: This response is sent to a request to a server endpoint that is not defined

405.description: This response is sent to any request sent to a valid location but with an method that is not supported

503.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

sAnalyzerSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the analyzer

sAnalyzerSoftwareVersion.description: The version of the software that is currently running on the analyzer

sAnalyzerFirmwareVersion.description: The version of the firmware that is currently running on the analyzer

sAnalyzerHardwareVersion.description: The version of the hardware the the analyzer consists of

errorDetail.description: A description of the problem with the request

errorStatus.description: The number of the HTTP error code

errorTitle.description: The title of the error indicated by the status

errorType.description: Additional error information if available describing the type of error

sConsumableName.description: A descriptive name of the consumable that can be used to uniquely identify it

sStartDateAndTime.description: The local date and time the measurement was started in format MM-DD-YYYY HH:MM:SS

sEndDateAndTime.description: The local date and time the measurement ended in format MM-DD-YYYY HH:MM:SS

nDuration_sec.description: The number of seconds the measurement took from start to end

sResult.description: The overall result of the measurement

oTestResults.description: The test results.  Will need to flush this out as we go on as to what this looks like

oMeasurementResult.description: This object will contain results of the most recent measurement

sMeasurementID.description: The ID value for a measurement

nElapsedTime_msec.description: The time the operation has taken so far

sStatusDetail.description: Additional information in plain text that describes the value status of the analyzer.  If no additional detail is available or necessary, this will be an empty string

sActivationTime.description: The local date and time the event was activated in format MM-DD-YYYY HH:MM:SS

sSeverity.description: A string value indicating the severity of the event

sEventAdditionalInformation.description: Additional information to describe the event that has occurred.  This can be anything that will help the operator understand in more detail the event

oEventInfo.description: This object will contain information about an event that occurred

aoSupportedConsumables.description: An array of objects describing the consumables supported by this analyzer.  Each item in the array represents a distinct type of consumable and should be validated by its own specific JSON schema.  If there was an error retrieving this information, this will be returned as an empty array

sScript.description: This string will contain a script that the analyzer will consume and begin the execution of

sFilename.description: This string will the full path to the file that stores the measurement script as it is stored on the analyzer

aoMeasurementResults.description: An array of measurement result objects that were taken in between the times sent in the request.  If there are no historical results to report, this will return as an empty array

aoCurrentlyActivatedEvents.description: An array of all events that are currently activated

sUUID.description: A unique identifier for the consumable

sSpecies.description: A list of the species this consumable may be used for

sDuration_sec.description: The number of seconds this consumable is expected to take to complete measurement

asAssays.description: A string list of all the supported assays

MeasurementStatus.description: This response is sent to notify the HUB of the status of a measurement that was requested to start, cancel, or whose status is being queried

400_BadRequest.description: This response is sent to a request that violates the predefined request schema

404_BadRequest.description: This response is sent to a request to a server endpoint that is not defined

405_MethodNotAllowed.description: This response is sent to any request sent to a valid location but with an method that is not supported

500_BadRequest.description: This response is sent to any request whose subsequent server response violates the predefined response schema

503_ServiceUnavailable.description: This response is sent to any request that the analyzer is unable to do at the time

sPartialVersionInfo.name: sPartialVersionInfo
sPartialVersionInfo.description: The specific part of the analyzer version

sPartialConfigurationInformation.name: sPartialConfigurationInformation
sPartialConfigurationInformation.description: The specific part of the analyzer configuration

sStartTime.name: sStartTime
sStartTime.description: The time to start looking for results to return

sStartDate.name: sStartDate
sStartDate.description: The date to start looking for results to return

sEndTime.name: sEndTime
sEndTime.description: The time to stop looking for results to return

sEndDate.name: sEndDate
sEndDate.description: The date to stop looking for results to return
